intro: Mesothema campylotis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mesothema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and opposite, contributing to its distinct appearance. Mesothema campylotis is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
